content.raw:
Ohhh I see, thanks for going through the trouble of making a video to clarify things! 

I see now what was confusing me so much! Even when it's set to `use_model_frame`, `xyz` is still *expressed* in the world frame, right? It's easier to draw than to explain with words:

![track_visual.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/ak8x4z/images/702126898-track_visual.png)

I was expecting something like `A`. So I think your implementation is `B`, correct? I think it's fine, it would be just nice to make it clear in the documentation that it's all expressed in the world frame.

And just to double check, there's no way to get to behaviour `A` using this set of parameters, right?
